definition: external appearance and inner thoughts coincide (idiom); to say what one means/to think and act as one
exterior surface/family relationship via females/to show (one's opinion)/a model/a table (listing information)/a form/a meter (measuring sth)

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: We were married forty-nine years and I was always faithful.
sentences.chinese: 我们的婚姻维持了49年，我始终表里如一。

sentences.english: Wasps in the third group suffered neither fate.
sentences.chinese: 第三组“表里如一”的胡蜂则没有受到任何攻击。

sentences.english: They're just going by hearsay and duplicating what they think the pro's are using.
sentences.chinese: 他们只是去的道听途说和重复表里如一亲的使用。

sentences.english: Madame Merle was not superficial-not she.
sentences.chinese: 梅尔夫人决不虚有其表，她是表里如一的。

sentences.english: Here if ever was a man all of a piece.
sentences.chinese: 要说真有表里如一的人的话，那就是此公了。

sentences.english: In addition, the tutelage also must persist the same standard all the time.
sentences.chinese: 此外，修养还要坚持表里如一的标准。

sentences.english: To do think that would otherwise cost.
sentences.chinese: 要想做到表里如一，还需另加花费。

definition: lit. heart and mouth as one (idiom); to say what you think/honest and straightforward
(idiom) one's actions are in keeping with what one says
outside appearance and inner reality differ (idiom); not what it seems/saying one thing but meaning sth different
to make a clear difference between what one likes and what one hates/to have well-defined likes and dislikes
open and candid (idiom); straightforward and upright
soft on the inside despite one's hard shell/appearing tough on the outside as to mask one's inner vulnerability/also written 內柔外剛|内柔外刚[nei4 rou2 wai4 gang1]
